page.title: 15MOUNT PLEASANT FARM
page.content: Mount Pleasant Farm and Fell Farm have merged in to one large farm. The two farms are mainly dairy farms, but Mount Pleasant Farm does grow some potatoes. Mount Pleasant Farm owns forty acres of land. It is used for grazing cattle and growing potatoes. Mount Pleasant is the cattle rearing part of the partnership. Fell Farm is used for dairy purposes. There are 90-100 cows milked every day. Half of the milk is bottled and delivered to local areas. The other half is taken by tank to the Barrow Co-op dairy. The farms have a lot of equipment. Some of it includes harrows, ploughs, a huge tank for milk and 4 tractors. There aren't a lot of farmworkers and the family are mainly used for labour.
